result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Leroy Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: any other probation sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample if needed.
Domestic Violence assessment.
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.
0 days credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Leroy Olson

defendant.name: Olson, Daniel Leroy
defendant.address: 218 W Charlotte Street #303, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

10:00 AM Defendant Daniel Leroy Olson in court.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch: guilty/no contest to charge; 1 year probation; domestic violence assessment, court costs ($543). Defendant agrees. Court goes over Defendant's rights to an attorney. Defendant waives right to attorney.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas no contest to charge.   Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights and waives right to attorney. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant guilty of charge. DA Hatch addresses sentencing.  Court orders S/W 1 year probation concurrent to any other probation sentence; court costs ($543), DNA sample, domestic violence assessment,   Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 0 days credit.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Def to report to probation today after the hearing. 10:14
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 24, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center today for fingerprints and photograph.
NO ABUSIVE OR VIOLENT CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH S.O.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.

9:42 AM Defendant Daniel Leroy Olson appears in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. DE would like to file a motion to dismiss. NG. DA Hatch is requesting a $2,500.00 SIBS w/conditions of NAC w/S.O. and AS, no objection. Court so orders. Court adjourned at 9:46 am  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
